intro: Glinus bainesii, commonly known as Baines' glinus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a velvety texture. Glinus bainesii is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
